Will arrives at the Walter house looking for his dad, George (Marc Blucas), and goes to find him on the ranch.
Later on, he returns back to the house as an ambulance arrives and says, "It's dad," implying that his father has had a health emergency.

title: Morgan Wallen Joins List of Artists Withdrawing Their Names From Grammy Consideration
summary: Morgan Wallen has decided his Billboard 200 No. 1 album won't be in the running for a 2026 Grammy Award, joining a list of artists who have boycotted the potential accolade.
story: Morgan Wallen has decided his Billboard 200 No. 1 album won't be in the running for a 2026 Grammy Award, joining a list of artists who have boycotted the potential accolade.
Representatives for Wallen confirmed to TODAY.com that the country music artist will not submit his latest album, “I’m the Problem,” for consideration at the 68th Grammys.
Wallen's album, which contains a whopping 37 songs, has sat at the top of Billboard 200 for 11 nonconsecutive weeks, marking the third time his album has hit No. 1 on the charts.
While Wallen hasn't spoken publicly about the decision, the singer has a controversial history with award shows.
The first round of voting for the Grammys runs Oct. 3-15, with nominations set to be announced Nov. 7. The Grammys will be held Feb. 1, 2026.
Why Is Morgan Wallen Removing His Album ‘I’m the Problem’ From Grammy Consideration?
Wallen has not publicly spoken about removing his name from Grammys consideration as of Aug. 25.
While the artist remains popular among country music fans and has had numerous No. 1 hits, Wallen has never won a Grammy and has only received two nominations.

At the 67th Grammy Awards, Wallen was nominated for his duet with Post Malone, “I Had Some Help,” for best country duo/group performance and best country song. Wallen has never been nominated for any work on his solo albums.
Wallen's controversial history and legal complications, however, have also led to some fraught relationships with award shows and his record label.

In 2020, Wallen was seen in videos partying without a mask amid the Covid-19 pandemic, violating restrictions at the time. He had been schedule to perform as the musical guest on “Saturday Night Live,” but was pulled from the spot after the videos surfaced. He was later rescheduled.
Months later in 2021, TMZ shared a video of a person who appeared to be Wallen using a racial slur. After the video surfaced, Wallen was suspended from his recording label, Big Loud Records.
Thereafter, Wallen issued an apology obtained by NBC News.

“I’m embarrassed and sorry. I used an unacceptable and inappropriate racial slur that I wish I could take back,” Wallen said. “There are no excuses to use this type of language, ever. I want to sincerely apologize for using the word. I promise to do better.”
That year, Wallen was banned from attending the 2021 Billboard Music Awards, as well as the American Music Awards. The Grammys, however, never disqualified Wallen from being nominated.
He has since been welcomed back to the ACM and CMA shows.
What Artists Have Removed Their Names from Grammy Considerations?
Drake has declined to submit his music for Grammy consideration for several years while also pointedly telling his fellow musicians that the award “doesn’t dictate s---- in our world.”

But Drake has had a longstanding history with the National Academy of Recording Arts & Sciences, receiving five Grammys and 55 nominations over the years. He also served as both performer and presenter prior to his critiques.

The “Family Matters” rapper’s criticism of the Grammys began in 2017, when his hit “Hotline Bling” won best rap song and best rap/sung performance. Drake slammed the Grammys for categorizing the song as rap, as opposed to pop.

“I’m a Black artist, I’m apparently a rapper, even though ‘Hotline Bling’ is not a rap song,” Drake said during in an interview with U.K. DJ Semtex. “The only category that they can manage to fit me in is in a rap category, maybe because I’ve rapped in the past or because I’m black. I can’t figure out why.”

In 2019, the last time Drake attended the Grammys, he accepted the award for best rap song for “God’s Plan” and gave a pointed acceptance speech about how he and the other artists there that night “play in an opinion-based sport, not a factual-based sport.”

After his album “Certified Lover Boy” was nominated in 2022 for best rap album and his single “Way 2 Sexy” was nominated for best rap performance, Drake asked the Recording Academy to remove his work from the nominations. The Academy honored Drake’s request and the rapper didn’t attend the awards show.

In 2023, although Drake refused to submit his 2022 album, “Honestly, Nevermind,” or any of its songs for consideration by the Grammys, he received four nominations. Once again, however, Drake boycotted the awards show.

In 2024, Drake received four Grammy nominations for his joint 2022 album with 21 Savage, “Her Loss.” Per the Grammys, Drake “submitted material for nomination for the 2024 GRAMMYs,” but the rapper, who did not attend that year, ultimately did not take home an award.
The Weeknd has also had a winding history with the Grammys, receiving 14 nominations and four wins over the years.
After his his “Blinding Lights” and “After Hours” were snubbed from nominations at the 2021 ceremony, The Weeknd announced he would not submit his work to Recording Academy.
He told The New York Times at the time that he will “no longer allow my label to submit my music to the Grammys” due to “secret committees” involved in the nomination process.

From 2022 to 2024, the singer boycotted the award show, until an unexpected return this past year, when the Weeknd sang “Cry For Me” and “Timeless” with Playboi Carti from his new album, “Hurry Up Tomorrow.”

Irish singer-songwriter and activist Sinéad O’Connor first performed at the Grammys in 1989, just two years before writing an open letter to the Recording Academy, criticizing “false and destructive materialistic values.”

Just a year prior to O’Connor’s pointed “SNL” performance, during which she destroyed a photo of Pope John Paul II on live television, she dropped her planned Grammys performance and published an open letter in 1991.

Directing her message to both the Academy and the industry at large, O'Connor wrote, per the Los Angeles Times, “They acknowledge mostly the commercial side of art. They respect mostly material gain, since that is the main reason for their existence. And they have created a great respect among artists for material gain--by honoring us and exalting us when we achieve it, ignoring for the most part those of us who have not.”

O’Connor won the best alternative music performance Grammy in 1991 for her album, “I Do Not Want What I Haven’t Got,” but refused to accept the award, marking the first time in Grammys history that an artist rejected a win.
O’Connor's letter led to waves of artists refusing to attend the awards show.

When best rap performance by a duo or group was not televised at the 1991 Grammys — following the award show's history of not televising wins in the rap category — nominee Public Enemy decided to boycott the show and released their own statement, via their label head Russell Simmons, that year.
When Living Colour guitarist Vernon Reid accepted the 1991 win for Best Hard Rock Performance, he donned a T-shirt displaying a giant photo of O’Connor.
In 2022, Bruno Mars told Rolling Stone that he and Anderson .Paak, who together make up R&B duo Silk Sonic, withdrew their album, “An Evening with Silk Sonic” from Grammys consideration.

“We truly put our all on this record, but Silk Sonic would like to gracefully, humbly and most importantly, sexually, bow out of submitting our album this year,” Mars told the outlet. “We hope we can celebrate with everyone on a great year of music and partake in the party. Thank you for letting Silk Sonic thrive.”
The two artists did not attend the 2023 ceremony.
Mars has received 33 Grammy nominations and 16 wins. His last win was at this past year’s ceremony in best pop duo/group performance for “Die With a Smile,” his duet with Lady Gaga.
What Artists Have Boycotted the Grammys?
Despite being the most decorated rapper in Grammys history with 89 nominations and 25 wins, Jay-Z has been critical of the Recording Academy and boycotted the award show for six years.

Jay-Z received his first nomination in 1998 for his third studio album, “Vol. 2... Hard Knock Life,” which took home best rap album at the 1999 Grammy Awards. The rapper was not in attendance to receive the award, however, as he boycotted the show.

During a speech at Clive Davis’ annual pre-Grammy gala in 2018, Jay-Z addressed his absence that year, explaining that he didn't attend the show because rapper DMX hadn't received any nominations, the Associated Press reported.

“I didn’t come back until... 2004 when a beautiful, young lady whom I love dearly had a solo album... the beautiful Miss Beyonce," Jay-Z said, per AP, referring to his wife. "And I realized, ‘Man, art is super subjective and everyone is doing their best, and the Academy, they’re human like we are and they’re voting on things they like and it’s subjective.’”
While he subsequently attended and performed at the Grammys over the years, Jay-Z had choice words for the Recording Academy once again in 2024 when accepting the Dr. Dre Global Impact Award.

At the time, his wife Beyoncé had never won album of the year, despite being nominated four times for her projects. (She won the award in 2025.) During his acceptance speech, Jay-Z seemingly called out the Grammys voting process.

“I don’t want to embarrass this young lady, but she has more Grammys than everyone, and never won album of the year,” he said, seemingly referring to his wife. “So even by your own metrics, that doesn’t work. Think about that. The most Grammys, never won Album of the Year. That doesn’t work.”
Beyoncé has received 99 nominations and won 35 of those times, making her the most decorated artist in Grammys history.
In 2019, Ariana Grande boycotted the Grammys after a creative disagreement with one of the award show's producers.

Grande was originally set to perform hit "7 Rings" during the show, but Grammys producer Ken Ehrlich reportedly told her she could only sing a portion of the song during a medley they had chosen, according to Variety.

At the time, Ehrlich told the AP that after the disagreements Grande “felt it was too late to pull something together.” The singer responded to his remarks, however, in since-deleted tweets saying she “can pull together a performance over night and you know that, Ken.”

Grande shared in the Twitter thread that she opted to not attend the Grammys “when my creativity & self expression was stifled” by Ehrlich, adding, “i hope the show is exactly what you want it to be and more.”

NBC News reported at the time that Grande later tweeted, “It’s about collaboration. it’s about feeling supported. it’s about art and honesty. not politics. not doing favors or playing games. it’s just a game y’all.. and i’m sorry but that’s not what music is to me.”
Similar to Jay-Z, Grande received her first Grammy win the same year she boycotted the event.
Grande, who has since accumulated 18 nominations and two wins, took home the Grammy for best pop vocal album, for “Sweetener.”
At the time, she acknowledged both the win and her absence in a since-deleted tweet.

“i know i’m not there tonight (trust, i tried and still truly wished it had worked out tbh) and i know i said i try not to put too much weight into things .... but (expletive) ....... this is wild and beautiful. thank you so much,” she shared at the time.
In 1989, Will Smith boycotted the Grammys in protest that the newly introduced best rap performance category wouldn't be televised.
The “Fresh Prince of Bel-Air” actor and musical partner DJ Jazzy Jeff were nominated that year for “Parents Just Don’t Understand.”

In a 1989 interview with Entertainment Tonight, Smith said they “don’t have the problem with the Grammy as an award or the Grammys as an institution, we just had a problem with the 1989 design of the awards show.”
“We chose to boycott,” he continued. “We feel that it’s a slap in the face.”

Reflecting on their decision in a 2016 interview with ET, Smith said the Recording Academy “(doesn’t) know anything about rap music” and clarified that the boycott the show was to “open their eyes to rap music so next year, some rapper will be able to perform at the Grammys and the awards will be televised because the music is large enough and important enough to be on the show.”
DJ Jazzy Jeff, whose real name is Jeffrey Allen Townes, told the outlet in the 2016 joint interview that they were told “there wasn’t enough time to televise all of the categories.”

“They televised 16 categories and, from record sales, from the Billboard charts, from the overall public’s view, there’s no way you can tell me that out of 16 categories, that rap isn’t in the top 16,” he added.
In a 2014 interview with BET, Townes said the Grammys asked the musical duo to perform in the televised portion of the show, while maintaining they couldn't televise their award category.
“It was almost like, you kind of want us to be the token,” Townes said in the interview. “This is our contribution to hip hop on the Grammys, but it’s not big enough for us to televise the category.”
Why Are Artists' Boycotting the Grammys Removing Themselves From Consideration?
While some artist have removed their work from future considerations after past snubs, others have took a stronger stance against the Recording Academy.

While Drake has been vocal about his message that a Grammy win “doesn’t dictate s---- in our world” as an artist, he has also made reference to his frustration with the Grammys in his music. In his 2023 collaboration with J. Cole, “First Person Shooter,” Drake boasts, “I told Jimmy Jam I use a Grammy as a door stop.”
When The Weeknd refused to submit his work for Grammys consideration in 2021, he referred to “secret committees” involved in the nomination process when talking to The New York Times.

In O'Connor's 1991 open letter to the Recording Academy, she wrote that they “acknowledge mostly the commercial side of art. They respect mostly material gain, since that is the main reason for their existence.” She added that the industry has “created a great respect among artists for material gain--by honoring us and exalting us when we achieve it, ignoring for the most part those of us who have not.”

In response, per the LA Times, former president of the Academy Michael Greene, said they “applaud that Sinead feels so strongly about these issues and believe that her convictions only add to the seriousness of her work,” while suggesting she “may be misguided.”

“I’m afraid that Sinead may not be properly informed about the difference between the overtly commercial aspects of popularity contests as opposed to the Grammys, which are voted on by the creative community.”

In a later interview with LA Times, however, O’Connor said, despite directing the letter to the Academy, she was “not criticizing the Grammys in particular,” clarifying, “I am criticizing the music industry. I am criticizing my peers . . . artists who are not doing their job.”

title: All the Easter Eggs in Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's Engagement, From 13 to 'Lover' Florals
summary: Fans have guessed that Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce may have hinted their Aug. 26 engagement to fans leading up to the big announcement.
story: When Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce announced their engagement with a series of photos on Instagram, excited fans picked up on small details that felt like winks from the celebrity couple.
Swift is known for dropping hints at her upcoming musical projects in her social media posts, public appearances and music videos.
During her Aug. 13 appearance on her fiancé Travis Kelce’s podcast “New Heights,” Swift shared that she would never use an easter egg to hint at something personal.
“I’m never going to plant an Easter egg that ties back to my personal life. It’s always going to be towards music,” she said during the episode.
Still, people are mining this very personal moment for clues. Here's a roundup of some popular Swiftie theories surrounding the couple's big announcement.
Are the Flowers a Throwback to the 'Lover' Era?
Swifties say the lush florals from the couple's engagement photos resemble flowers from one of the singer's past photoshoots.
One eagle-eyed fan noted on X compared the proposal pictures to a photoshoot from Swift’s romantic “Lover” era.
In the 2019 pictures, Swift is shown sitting alone in the middle of a garden in a pink sweatshirt, surrounded by pink roses.
“taylor swift engagement pictures are giving lover photoshoot and I’m emotional,” one fan wrote on X.

Some also pointed out that the pictures reminded them of a photo that music producer Jack Antonoff posted of himself fake proposing to Swift during her "Midnights" era. In the picture, Antonoff and Kelce stand before a floral arch — just like Kelce and Swift do in their engagement photos.
Coincidence or not, the photo of Swift and Antonoff was posted on the same date as Swift’s real engagement announcement, three years prior.
The Announcement's Numerology, from 13 to 26
On the “New Heights” podcast, Swift emphasized that she loves to play with numerology, specifically by referencing number 13 in her projects.
She considers the number lucky largely because she was born on Dec. 13, a detail she shared early on in her career.
Followers of Swift's career have often noticed that she plans important moments on dates that include the number, and it seems like her engagement was no exception.

The proposal was posted on Instagram exactly 13 days after her appearance on “New Heights,” fans noticed, which was aired on Aug. 13. It also was shared right at 1 p.m. ET, which is 13:00 in military time.
Some Swifties also pointed out on X that the proposal was posted on the 26th of the month, which is 13 divided by two.
To take the numerology clues even further, fans noticed that the announcement took place 39 days, which is 13 divided by three, before the release of her next album, “The Life of a Showgirl.”
Some observers shared on social media that the number-related hints sprinkled throughout the announcement feels appropriate for the numerology-obsessed star.

“Proposing on the 13th of the month WOULD make so much sense for someone proposing to Taylor Swift the queen of 13 and numerology. Also proposing on the day the podcast epi dropped seems like a romantic time to do it,” one user wrote on X.
Did the 'New Heights' Episode Hint at an Engagement?
During an Aug. 27 episode of Travis Kelce’s podcast “New Heights,” which he co-hosts with his brother, Jason Kelce, Travis Kelce said that his previous episode with Swift included easter eggs.
“She was having so much fun getting to tell everybody about the album and obviously drop a few easter eggs and see if everyone caught on,” Travis Kelce said during the episode.
He dodged sharing any more details but still left fans wondering if the Aug. 13 "New Heights" episode included any hints that the couple would soon be engaged.
In an interview with ABC News 5 Cleveland, Travis Kelce’s dad, Ed Kelce, gave insight to the timing of the engagement. He said his son proposed “about two weeks ago.”
“Travis actually did the proposal, oh, maybe two weeks, not quite two weeks ago. He was going to put it off ‘til this week,” he said.
This information has led some fans to guess that Kelce proposed after they filmed the episode.

“I have a theory. I think he proposed the same day as the podcast. They just did outfit changes for dinner. If you look closely you’ll notice she’s wearing the same bracelet, watch, and two rings on her right hand. And her nails are the same color,” one fan guessed on X.

Another fan noted that in the engagement photos, it looks like Swift's hair has an indent from a pair of headphones similar to the ones she wore during the podcast episode, which could mean that Kelce proposed after they finished filming.
Swift's Diamond Might Look Familiar
Swifties have also noticed a parallel between the shape of Swift’s engagement diamond and the logo she included on the May letter announcing that she had bought back her masters.

The logo, which is featured at the top of Swift’s announcement, is a rectangular oval with the letters “TS” intertwined inside for her initials. A few Swifties have noted that the shape is remarkably similar to her engagement ring, which features an elongated cushion cut diamond.

“Hold up a minute. I knew this ring shape looked familiar,” one fan said on TikTok of the stone’s resemblance to the logo from her letter. “There is no coincidence here, OK? Let’s be honest,” she continued.
The parallel between the ring and the logo have some fans speculating that Swift was involved in planning the proposal.
Other fans point out that Kelce didn’t propose before Swift announced the purchase of her masters, as his haircut in the photos seems more consistent with recent appearances.
So, assuming the ring was a surprise, it might not be possible that Swift knew what her ring would look like back in May.
“Based on his haircut, this has to be recent as he didn’t cut it until the end of July at training camp,” one fan guessed in the comments of the video.
The Emoji in the Engagement Announcement, Explained
Some have found special meaning in the emoji used by the pair when sharing their engagement.
“Your English teacher and your gym teacher are getting married 🧨” the caption read.
Fans theorized that the dynamite represents TNT — which also could stand for “Taylor and Travis.”
“THE DYNAMITE EMOJI BC THEYRE TNT,” one Swiftie exclaimed on X.
Kelce has given Swift a bracelet with the letters “TNT."
'So High School' and the Post's Caption
References to high school teachers in the couple's engagement announcement have fans pondering what the duo is saying about their relationship.
It might go back to the song "So High School," a track off of Swift's most recent album "The Tortured Poet's Department."

Listeners have connected the song's lyrics to Swift's relationship with Kelce, as lines from the song seem to reference his football career. In the track, Swift sings that she "feels so high school" when she is with the song's love interest.
"Truth, dare, spin bottles / You know how to ball, I know Aristotle," Swift sings in one of the verses.
Fans of the song guess what Swift's lyrical association of Kelce with high school mean to the star.

"They’re in their mid 30’s and he makes her feel so high school," one user speculated on Reddit. "When you think of high school love, you think of first loves, of innocence and falling in love so fast. It’s fun and it’s sweet and that’s really the essence of the song."

"The whole ball vs Aristotle is exactly like a cheesy teen movie from the early 2000’s where the jock falls in love with the nerdy girl, kind of like in the video for You Belong with Me," another noted.

Swift's pairing of Kelce and high school, a life stage she referenced throughout her career in tracks such as "You Belong with Me" and "Fifteen," is also evident in the couple's engagement Instagram caption, which refers to both of them as teachers.

Some say the caption references fans' inside jokes with the singer, as listeners have historically compared Swift to an English teacher due to the literary references that frequently pop up in her music.
"ENGLISH AND GYM TEACHER SHE SEES OUR TWEETS OMG," one fan wrote on X.

"Swifties call her the English teacher because if she hadn’t been a singer/songwriter she would have been an English teacher,"  another explained. "I don’t know where the joke originated but she does have the attitude of a teacher."
This much is for sure: Swift, in English teacher fashion, has taught her fans to close read all everything from posts to lyrics to captions — and they are acing the assignment.

title: Which 'Love Island USA' Couples Are Still Together Now?
summary: Wondering which 'Love Island USA' couples lasted? Here's an updated list of who’s still dating and who’s split since leaving the villa.
story: Maybe the real, real prize on "Love Island USA" wasn't the $100,000, but the opportunity to find a connection that could survive beyond the Fiji villa's sun-soaked bubble.
When the cameras stop rolling, though, how many couples actually last?

Some "Love Island USA" couples have defied the odds, turning their villa romance into lasting love stories that include engagements, shared apartments and anniversary posts that make us believe in reality TV romance again.
Others? Well, let’s just say not every "Love Island" love story gets a fairytale ending.
Here's a recap of the couples from "Love Island USA" who are still together — as far as we know.
'Love Island USA' Seasons 1 to 4 Couples
Unfortunately, love did not last for the couples who continued their relationships outside the villa from "Love Island USA" Seasons 1 through 4.

Fan-favorite duos like Zac Mirabelli and Elizabeth Weber (Season 1 winners), Justine Ndiba and Caleb Corprew (Season 2 winners), and Korey Gandy and Olivia Kaiser (Season 3 winners) all called it quits after the show ended. Even relationships that seemed strong during the reunion episodes eventually fizzled.
'Love Island USA' Season 5 Couples Still Together

Crowned the winners of Season 5, Hannah Wright and Marco Donatelli were a couple for Hannah's entire villa journey. The pair proved their connection was built to last, and they recently announced their engagement on Instagram.
Carsten Bergersen, aka Bergie, began his "Love Island USA" experience as an original Islander, but his journey to find love wasn't easy.

It wasn't until Day 21 when bombshell Taylor Nicole Smith entered the villa that the stars aligned for Bergie. Not only did the couple make it to the finale, securing third place for the season, but the pair remains strong today, sharing their favorite moments together with fans on their social media.
'Love Island USA' Season 6 Couples Still Together
In a twist that shocked "Love Island" fans, JaNa Craig and Kenny Rodriguez from Season 6 have split up. Two couples from the season are still together, however.
Serena Page and Kordell Beckham's bond started slow, with both wanting to build the foundation of their relationship on friendship.
The pair remained a couple almost the entire season, except during Casa Amor, when Kordell shockingly returned to the main villa hand-in-hand with a bombshell.
The aftermath of Kordell's return from Casa was explosive, with Serena angry, heartbroken and seemingly ready to leave the relationship in the past.
Casa Amor ultimately brought the pair closer than ever. They re-coupled and claimed their status as king and queen of the villa when they were crowned the winners of Season 6 just one week later.
The couple made their relationship official in August 2024 and have been seemingly inseparable since.
Leah Kateb began her "Love Island" journey as an original Islander, but it wasn’t until bombshell Miguel Harichi entered the villa that she found her perfect match.
The pair’s relationship blossomed quickly, with both Miguel and Leah proving they were willing to fight for their connection.

The ended Season 6 as the runner-ups. The couple remains together today, regularly sharing glimpses of their relationship on social media and showing fans that their villa connection has successfully transitioned into a real-world love story.
‘Love Island USA’ Season 7 Couples Still Together
Fans hoped the Season 7 winners Amaya Espinal and Bryan Arenales would continue their happily ever after post villa. Unfortunately, the two called it quits over a month after they left Fiji.
Four couples are seemingly still together as of Aug. 27.

Nic Vansteenberghe and Olandria Carthen were fan favorites long before they became a couple and secured third place during "Love Island USA" Season 7. The pair haven’t been shy about showcasing their post-villa romance.
Both explored strong connections with other islanders throughout the show, but fate (or production) kept drawing them back to each other.

The couple has been practically inseparable since leaving Fiji, spending their time together at cast outings, on a trip to Greece, watching “Nicolandria” ship edits of themselves during TikTok lives, and collaborating on modeling shoots.
In an exclusive interview with TODAY.com, Olandria gushed about the internet's love for her and Nic; specifically the "Nicolandria" edits.

"I love it. The edits tell our story beautifully, from beginning to end," she said. "And some of them even bring me to tears sometimes, like this is so beautiful. To know that we were unintentionally doing all this, like none of that was forced."
Following the Aug. 25 reunion, which was taped on Aug. 12, they remained exclusive.
Perhaps one of the most surprising pairings of the season, these two bombshells are enjoying their romance outside the villa.
Iris Kendall and Jose “Pepe” Garcia-Gonzalez entered the villa together as bombshells, looking to shake up the villa and find their own connections.
Confiding in one another when their significant others were gone, Iris and Pepe realized there was more than just a friendship between them— there were romantic sparks.
Since coming in fourth place of Season 7 and leaving Fiji, the pair seems to be enjoying each other's company in their shared hometown of Los Angeles.
In an exclusive interview with TODAY.com, Pepe confirmed the status of the pair's relationship.

"I think at this point, everybody kind of knows we’re together, obviously," Pepe told TODAY.com. "They know it’s very different than normal relationships ... it’s just, continue to be with each other and focus on each other and just make sure that we can see this through."
However, many people are speculating they might have parted ways after the reunion.
Out of all the couples going strong since leaving Fiji, Chelley and Ace's connection has been brewing the longest.
Chelley and Olandria were the first Islanders to enter the villa on Day 1, and when Ace walked in, Chelley couldn't believe her eyes.
"Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait. This can't be real life," Chelley said as Ace walked through the villa toward her and the other girls.
"I know you," Ace said as he approached Chelley, giving her a hug.
When host Ariana Madix asked Ace to clarify how he knows Chelley, he explained, "I met her in New York actually. Outside of a club, actually, yeah."
"This is crazy," Chelley replied.

And so, the season-long romance began. Though the pair clearly had a connection from the jump, they both were adamant about keeping themselves open to getting to know other people. After exploring other connections, Chelley and Ace officially coupled up.
Then came Casa Amor. True to their word, both Chelley and Ace kept exploring other connections, and both decided to re-couple with someone else when returning from the Casa Amor experiment.

Despite their explorations outside each other, there was no denying their chemistry, and the pair decided to re-couple. From then on, the pair's connection only grew, and they became exclusive during a date in the Hideaway.
Since leaving the villa, the couple has enjoyed spending time together, posting a sweet video of their day at Disneyland with the Season 7 cast on their Instagrams.
Ace even said he was in love with Chelley during the Season 7 reunion.
Taylor Williams and Clarke Carraway are going strong after leaving the villa.

“We’re still the same as we were in the villa,” Taylor told TODAY.com after the finale. “That’s why I used the word exclusive instead of closed off. Closed off is a villa term. You’re not in the outside world saying, ‘We’re closed off.’”

Clarke entered the show as a bombshell in Episode 19 and they connected immediately. The connection is there — but now they're facing the hurdle of long-distance. Taylor is from Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, while Clarke is from Charlotte, North Carolina.

“I’m going to go to Oklahoma and do the rodeo situation, and then he’s going to come visit me in Charlotte,” Clarke told TODAY.com. “Definitely, like a lot of traveling, but things to look forward to.”
The two confirmed their relationship status during the reunion.

title: Are Amaya and Bryan Still Together After Winning 'Love Island USA'?
summary: Are Amaya Espinal and Bryan Arenales still together after winning "Love Island USA" and amid breakup rumors? Here's what we know.
story: It was not happily ever after for “Love Island USA” Season 7 winners Amaya Espinal and Bryan Arenales after all.
The pair was voted as America's favorite, emerging victorious and receiving the $100,000 cash prize. They then left the villa as a couple, with fans hoping they'd make it in the real world.
Unfortunately, over a month after the Season 7 finale and two days after the reunion special aired, Amaya and Bryan confirmed that they had broken up.
All seemed well with the winning couple, who, in an interview with TODAY.com soon after the finale, emphasized their relationship's authenticity.
“Honestly, I’m so happy to be here with her. Trust me, it’s real,” Bryan said at the time.
“I’m also a bad actress and a bad liar — I think people would be able to catch on quickly,” Amaya chimed in. “I’m like, I need Botox after this, he makes me smile this much.”
However, breakup rumors circulated and reached a fever pitch ahead of the “Love Island USA” Season 7 Reunion.
Both Amaya and Bryan unfollowed each other on Instagram, adding fuel to split speculation that first surfaced earlier this summer.
The rumors began swirling when Bryan was allegedly spotted  with another woman at a nightclub just days after the couple left the villa together.

At the time, the pair seemed to shut down the chatter with a romantic TikTok posted to Bryan’s account. “When everyone thinks you’re over meanwhile this is us,” read the caption, accompanying footage of the couple gazing into each other’s eyes before Amaya leaped into Bryan’s arms.
Bryan addressed the rumors during the reunion special. Here's what to know.
What Happened Between Amaya and Bryan on ‘Love Island USA’?
Amaya’s journey to find love in Fiji was far from straightforward.
Entering the villa as a bombshell on Episode 4 alongside Hannah Fields, Amaya originally coupled up with Ace Greene.
While there seemed to be a spark between the pair at first, Ace quickly switched up on Amaya, citing her usage of nicknames (particularly “babe”) and physical touch as too much, too soon.
From there, Amaya found more connections and obstacles. She coupled up with Austin Shepard on Episode 14, but he, like Ace, began to distance himself from Amaya.
The couple split up when Casa Amor happened on Episode 19, leaving them both single and open to exploring new connections.

Bryan came into the show as a bombshell in Casa Amor, the biggest relationship test of every “Love Island” season. This is where either the men or the women from the main villa are secretly whisked away to a second villa nearby, where they get to meet a group of other singles hoping to find love in Fiji.

In Casa Amor, Bryan quickly hit it off with Andreina. Amaya, meanwhile, was striking up a connection with Zak Srakaew, who also came into the show during Casa Amor. They ultimately coupled up and remained a couple as they went back to the main villa.
However, Zak blindsided Amaya during the “Stand on Business” challenge and gang up on her alongside Austin and Ace, which led to Amaya exploring new connections and hitting it off with Bryan.
Wait, What Happened During the ‘Stand on Business’ Challenge?
During the “Stand on Business” challenge in Episode 26, Amaya was confronted by all three men she had previously been coupled up with: Ace, Austin and Zak.
As Amaya stood in front of her peers, she read cards that had been written about her — specifically about her emotions and how she expressed herself in her relationships.
“You cry more than needed. You try to move too fast for everyone,” Austin wrote on a card that Amaya had to read in front of the entire villa.
“God forbid I’m a sensitive gangsta,” Amaya replied (a phrase that became one of her signature one-liners).

“I would just have to say that many people could view this as a weakness, but to me personally, after everything I’ve been through in my life, I view it as a strength,” she continued. “So if you guys view it like that, then guess what. I’m just not your cup of tea to be drinking, so don’t f------ drink it.”
Austin admitted to writing the card, explaining that after they initially coupled up, “the intensity of your emotions and feelings and wants just felt like they built way up.”

Ace and Zak decided to join Austin and gang up on Amaya in front of everyone. But what could have been Amaya’s lowest point in the villa actually became a silver lining, as this is where her and Bryan’s story began.

“One thing I got to add though,” Bryan interjected that night. “Coming from a Hispanic household, calling someone ‘Babe,’ ‘Mi amor,’ ‘Mi vida,’ that’s just how we talk. You’re telling her meet you halfway, you got to meet her halfway, too.”
The following day, Amaya and Bryan had a chat and started to get to know one another. Bryan not only understood Amaya, but he loved the way she expressed herself.

The pair coupled up on Episode 30, and America eventually voted to send them to the Season 7 finale. Viewers got to see their final date and declarations of love, the loving speeches all the final couples give to one another right before the winners are announced.
During their first and final date, Amaya expressed her appreciation for Bryan, especially for how he spoke on her behalf during the “Stand on Business” challenge.

“Babe, you don’t understand how much it meant, that moment, of you standing up for me in the Stand on Business,” she told him. “You know, like, if my light is too bright for somebody, wear sunglasses or something.”
“But with you, you looked right into the sun, you know?” she continued.
Bryan “popped the question,” as Amaya put it in her confessional later in the episode, to continue exclusively dating each other when they left Fiji.
“I just wanted to talk to you and just basically let you know how much I care about you and how much you mean to me here,” he said.

“And I love your energy, I love when you get the zoomies ... Just making everybody’s day better. Fine as hell ... I definitely wanted to leave here letting you know that I want to make stuff exclusive with us and prioritize us. I want to continue taking the right steps with you and attacking the outside world with you.”
Are Amaya and Bryan Still Together Now?
No, Amaya and Bryan are not together anymore.

The couple publicly confirmed their exclusive relationship after leaving the villa and during a profile with TODAY.com, which was published on Aug. 20. At the time, Amaya said she visited Bryan's family in Boston.
“I had such a great time, met his mom — it was just very wholesome,” Amaya said.

But their decision to unfollow each other on Instagram signaled serious trouble in paradise. Adding to the breakup speculation, Amaya reposted a cryptic TikTok video the same day fans noticed the social media snub.

The video says, “How it feels when you know you have to leave him alone,” over pictures of  girls crying, alone, or looking forlornly. The caption features a few hashtags, including “#ex,” “#sad,” and “#imissyou.”
On Aug. 27, Amaya confirmed that she and Bryan were “no longer together.”

“After leaving the villa, it became clear that we were on two different journeys. Our visions didn’t align and relationships are suppose to be a team sport,” she wrote. “You don’t have to drink the whole sea to know it’s salty.”
“All the love here and I truly wish him the best,” she wrote, signing off, “Amaya Papaya.”

Bryan also posted his own statement on his Instagram story, beginning, “As many of you already know. Amaya and I have decided to go our separate ways. Unfortunately, we were not on the same page and that is Okay.”
“We have both gained clarity that we are on different paths right now,” he continued, adding he was “thankful” for the time they spent together “and I wish her nothing but the best moving forward.”
During the reunion, which was taped on Aug. 12 and aired Aug. 25, Bryan spoke about the cheating allegations.
“I got paid to be there... I had a lapse in judgment. We’ve talked about it,” he said, before clarifying that he was, “Pouring shots around, giving the crowd shots and stuff like that.”
At the time, Amaya said, “I’m not a woman that would be with someone who doesn’t respect me,” and appeared to still be a couple.

title: 'Love Island USA' Winners Amaya and Bryan Break Up
summary: “Love Island USA” Season 7 winner Amaya Espinal reveals that she and Bryan Arenales have officially broken up.
story: “Love Island USA” Season 7 winners Amaya Espinal and Bryan Arenales have officially split.
On Aug. 27, two days after the reunion aired, Amaya revealed on her Instagram story that she and Bryan “are no longer together.”

“After leaving the villa, it became clear that we were on two different journeys. Our visions didn’t align and relationships are suppose to be a team sport,” she wrote. “You don’t have to drink the whole sea to know it’s salty.”
She concluded, “All the love here and I truly wish him the best,” signing off with her monitor Amaya Papaya.
Hours later, Bryan posted his own statement on his Instagram story.
“As many of you already know. Amaya and I have decided to go our separate ways,” he began. “Unfortunately, we were not on the same page and that is Okay.”
He continued, “We have both gained clarity that we are on different paths right now.”
Bryan noted that he’s “thankful” for the time they spent together “and I wish her nothing but the best moving forward.”
Fans had speculated to possible trouble in paradise after they unfollowed each other on Instagram ahead of the Aug. 25 “Love Island USA” Season 7 reunion.
During the reunion, which was taped on Aug. 12 in New York, the pair shared that they were still together and had just visited his mom.
Bryan, however, did touch on cheating allegations after he was spotted at a nightclub.
“I got paid to be there... I had a lapse in judgment. We’ve talked about it,” he said.
When asked to clarify what “lapse in judgement” meant, he said, “Pouring shots around, giving the crowd shots and stuff like that.”
Amaya paid no attention to the speculation, saying, “I’m not a woman that would be with someone who doesn’t respect me.”
The pair also appeared to have moved on and enjoyed spending time together, with Amaya telling TODAY.com during their photo shoot, “He always makes it a priority to make sure that we’re both OK.”

title: What Travis Kelce's Parents Have Said About Taylor Swift
summary: Donna and Ed Kelce have showered their future daughter-in-law Taylor Swift with praise since she and their son Travis Kelce began dating in 2023.
story: Travis Kelce's parents, Donna and Ed Kelce, have spoken glowingly about future daughter-in-law Taylor Swift since the 14-time Grammy winner began dating their younger son, Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce, in the summer of 2023.

Donna Kelce seemingly gave the couple's romance her blessing when she sat in the player's box with Swift at Arrowhead Stadium in Kansas City when Swift showed up to cheer on her then-rumored beau at her first Chiefs game on Sept. 24, 2023.
Mama Kelce, as fans call her, as well as Ed Kelce, would go on to sit alongside the “Karma” singer at many more Chief games over the next two years.
Now that Travis Kelce, 35, has popped the question to Swift, also 35, let's take a look back at what his mom and dad have said publicly about his bride-to-be.
October 2023: Donna Kelce Asked About Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift's Romance During TODAY Visit
Mama Kelce remained almost comically tight-lipped about the status of her son's relationship with Swift during an Oct. 6, 2023, visit to TODAY.
At the time, the rumored couple had not publicly confirmed they were together.
“It’s fairly new, so I don’t like to talk about it,” said the protective mom, who was spotted hugging and laughing with Swift at a Chiefs game just days before.
“It’s just one of those things where you know, obviously everybody saw me. I was in the boxes with her and it’s just another thing that’s amped up my life," she added.
When asked if she thought it was a budding romance, she said at the time, “I honestly can’t tell you. It’s just too new.”
When pushed to describe what it was like to sit with Swift in the players box, Mama Kelce would only offer, “It was OK.”
She added that she preferred not to discuss either of her sons’ personal lives.

“I’ll talk about my life and when the kids were little and I was with them, but they’re men now,” she said. “They’ve got their own lives and there isn’t a man alive that’s going to talk to their mom about their personal life. It’s just not gonna happen.”
October 2023: Donna Kelce Comments on Newfound Attention on Her Family
The same day, Mama Kelce appeared on the “Got It From My Momma” podcast where she opened up about the media attention on her family since Swift had started attending Chief's games.
“I feel like I’m in an alternate universe because it’s something that I’ve never been involved with before,” she said of the hype.
She added that she was aware that Swift’s presence at the games had inspired more young girls and women to tune into “Sunday Night Football.”
“I had one dad who DM’ed me, and he said, ‘Finally, finally, my daughter is watching football with me,’” she said.
October 2023: Donna Kelce Reveals her Favorite Swift Song
Around the same time, Donna Kelce told People she never considered herself a Swiftie before the pop star started dating her son.
“My era was Earth, Wind and Fire, Chaka Khan, things like that. That’s more my music,” she said.
“But obviously, talent is talent," she added.
The proud football mom also revealed her favorite Swift song: “Shake It Off.”
November 2023: Donna Kelce Says Travis Kelce Is 'Happier Than I’ve Seen Him In a Long Time’
By the time Donna Kelce spoke to WSJ. Magazine in November 2023, Travis Kelce and Swift had publicly confirmed they were together.
“I can tell you this. He’s happier than I’ve seen him in a long time," she told the publication.
She added, "God bless him, he shot for the stars!”
November 2023: Donna Kelce Praises 'Eras Tour' Concert Film
In an interview with People published November 2023, Donna Kelce had high praise for the “Eras Tour” concert film.
“I did see it and I did like it. It was awesome,” she said.
She went on to describe Swift as “extremely, extremely talented” and said she “was just totally enthralled” while watching her movie.
She added that she also admired Swift's ability "to connect with people.”
“That’s just amazing,” she said.
February 2024: Donna Kelce's Facebook Cover Photo Includes Swift
Just ahead of the 2024 Super Bowl, Mama Kelce updated her Facebook cover photo to a group shot that included Swift. During an appearance on TODAY days later, she explained why she added the photo.

“That was a picture where all of us were so excited that we’re in the suite. And we were so excited that (the Chiefs) made it to the Super Bowl that we just took a shot of everybody that was there,” she said.
“So it wasn’t anything calculating or anything like that,” she added. “It just was everybody that was supporting my son and I was so happy to put that picture on Facebook.”
February 2024: Donna Kelce and Swift Hold Hands After Chiefs Win Super Bowl
At the 2024 Super Bowl, Donna Kelce and Swift joined forces again to cheer for the Kansas City Chiefs, who beat the San Francisco 49ers.
After the Chiefs' win, Swift and Donna Kelce held hands as they walked onto the field to congratulate Travis Kelce.
February 2024: Ed Kelce Praises the 'Real Taylor'
Ed Kelce, who first met Swift months before, praised the singer for being “gracious” with the fans who swarm her at Chiefs games.
“Every game there’s people crowding outside the front of that suite trying to get a glimpse of Taylor, wanting to meet Taylor," he said during an interview with the Los Angeles Times.

“Taylor’s very gracious, but she can’t do everything,” he went on. “And she’s got security guys who don’t want her doing anything. That’s their job and she’s smart enough to know, ‘I’m paying these guys to keep me safe. I should probably listen to them.’”
“But if it was up to her she’d be out there with everyone who wants her," he added.
Ed Kelce revealed that he'd gotten a good sense of who Swift was when she gave the commencement speech at New York University in May 2022, where she also received an honorary doctorate of fine arts.

“Listening to that, you get a much better sense of who this young woman is, as opposed to the social media blurbs and the gossip magazines,” he said. “That’s all celebrity stuff. This is more the real Taylor.”
November 2024: Donna Kelce Shares If Swift Will Attend Kelce Family Thanksgiving Dinner
When Mama Kelce dropped by TODAY on Nov. 14, 2024, she said her Thanksgiving plans that year, like every year, would include football.
“Travis is playing the day after Thanksgiving,” she said. “You know, football is always the holidays. Football’s family.”
TODAY’s Craig Melvin then asked if Swift would be a part of the holiday his year.
“I don’t think so,” Donna Kelce said. “She’s kind of busy right now. She still has her tour to do.”

Swift wrapped up her U.S. “Eras Tour” shows on Nov. 3 in Indianapolis, and then returned to the stage in Toronto from Nov. 14-16, and then again Nov. 21-23. Swift wrapped up her record-breaking tour on Dec. 8 in Vancouver.
April 2024: Donna Kelce Says 'The Tortured Poets Department' Is Swift's 'Best Work'
Mama Kelce shared how much she enjoyed Swift’s newly released album, “The Tortured Poets Department,” during an April 24 interview with People.
“I listened to the whole album, and I listened to it all morning long when it was released,” she shared.
“I was just very impressed,” she said. “She is a very talented woman and I think it is probably her best work.”
When the NFL mom was asked during the interview if she had any advice for Swift about aging, she responded, “She doesn’t need my advice on anything. In fact, I hope she will give me advice.”
August 2025: Ed Kelce Shares Details About His Son's Proposal to Swift
Hours after Swift and Travis Kelce announced their engagement on Instagram on Aug. 26, Ed Kelce revealed details about how his son proposed to Swift while chatting with ABC News 5 Cleveland.
“Travis actually did the proposal, oh, maybe two weeks, not quite two weeks ago. He was going to put it off ‘til this week,” Ed Kelce shared.
The proud dad explained his son wanted to make his proposal to Swift “some grand thing” and a “big special event.”

“He got her out there, they were about to go out to dinner, and he said, ‘Let’s go out and have a glass of wine,’ ... they got out there, and that’s when he asked her, and it was beautiful,” he said, sharing the proposal happened at a garden in Missouri. “They started FaceTiming me and their mother and her folks to make sure everybody knew. So, to see them together is great.”
Ed Kelce said “about a week ago” he asked his son when he and Swift would announce their engagement.
“He said, ‘Whenever Taylor says so,’” he said.
Ed Kelce added that he’d personally known Travis Kelce would ask Swift to marry him ever since his last NFL season.
“That’s when it became obvious they were just crazy about each other,” he said.

title: Craig Melvin Revisits His Hilarious Proposal Story in the Wake of Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce Engagement
summary: Craig Melvin shared his proposal story to Lindsay Czarniak in the aftermath of Taylor Swift's engagement to Travis Kelce.
story: After Taylor Swift shared photos from her swoonworthy garden proposal, TODAY’s Craig Melvin looked back at his own big moment leading up to “I do.”

Speaking with Holly Palmieri, anchor of the TODAY Show Radio on SiriusXM, Craig recalled the day he proposed to Lindsay Czarniak, his wife of nearly 14 years, sharing that it wasn't quite an immediate, "yes."
When asked if he got down on one knee in a garden like Swift’s newly minted fiancé, Travis Kelce, Craig chuckled.
“Not a garden,” Craig shared. “I did it on a boat down in Miami.”

The co-anchor shared that the location wasn’t random. Miami was a place special to Czarniak: It was where she had worked and lived for some time before they married. Still, while Craig went all in, his plans didn’t exactly go off without a hitch.
“It was a surprise, and it almost didn’t go well,” he said. “I was all fumbly, and the boat was late.”
Finally, when he got the chance to propose, Craig shared that Czarniak’s first reaction wasn’t exactly the one he’d expected.

“The first thing she said to me after I asked her, I had prepared this thing in my head, I kid you not — she's going to hate me for telling this story ... she said, 'I think I'm going to throw up,'" Craig recalled.

“And in the moment, I was like, maybe I misread this. Maybe I overplayed my hand. It seems like it’s been going well for a couple of years. And then she’s like, “No, no, no ... yes. I just, I’m just, ‘I think I’m gonna be sick.’”

TODAY's Laura Jarrett chimed in that Czarniak was probably just "overwhelmed." She also assured Craig that his now wife's unexpected response — paired with her eventual "yes" — actually made his story all the sweeter.

“I think it’s nice to still be surprised. I think there are so few surprises anymore,” Laura explained. “Everything is overly scripted and overly done, and it’s just nice when it’s like, you didn’t get to see the ring, you didn’t know where it was gonna be, and it's just the two of you.”
“Thanks for making me feel better,” Craig replied.
Craig and Czarniak have been married since 2011. Together, they share two children: a son named Delano, born in March 2014, and a daughter, Sybil, born in November 2016.

title: Donna Kelce Celebrates Travis and Taylor's Engagement with Childhood Pics of Both
summary: Donna Kelce changed her Facebook cover photo to a pair of pictures of son Travis and Taylor Swift as kids to celebrate their engagement news.
story: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are getting married, and it seems as if his mother couldn’t be happier these crazy kids are tying the knot.
On Aug. 27, Donna Kelce changed her Facebook cover photo to feature pictures of her Kansas City Chiefs star son and Swift as children.
The updated cover photo prompted fans to chime in in the comments with their congratulations about the impending nuptials.
Travis Kelce and Swift announced their engagement in a joint Instagram post on Aug. 26.
“Your English teacher and your gym teacher are getting married,” they captioned a quintet of photos, adding an emoji of a stick of dynamite.

Donna Kelce has certainly made an impression on the “Blank Space” singer. Swift called her and Patrick Mahomes’ wife, Brittany Mahomes, her “two pillars of support” in the six-part ESPN documentary “The Kingdom: Kansas City Chiefs.”
Donna Kelce also had high praise for Swift after the release of the music superstar's last album, 2024’s “The Tortured Poets Department.”
“I was just very impressed,” she told People. “She is a very talented woman and I think it is probably her best work.”
Donna Kelce was also asked if she has any advice for Swift about aging, prompting her to say she “doesn’t need my advice on anything.”
“In fact, I hope she will give me advice,” she added.
Donna Kelce, who has been spotted with Swift at Chiefs games, has also said the Grammy winner had a positive effect on her son.
“I can tell you this,” she told WSJ. Magazine in 2023. “He’s happier than I’ve seen him in a long time ... God bless him, he shot for the stars!”

Travis Kelce’s dad and Donna Kelce’s ex-husband, Ed Kelce, also seems pleased about the relationship. He said his son and Swift actually got engaged at a garden in Lee’s Summit, Missouri, about two weeks before they announced the news.

“He got her out there, they were about to go out to dinner, and he said, ‘Let’s go out and have a glass of wine’ ... they got out there, and that’s when he asked her, and it was beautiful,” he told ABC affiliate WEWS in Cleveland.
“They started FaceTiming me and their mother and her folks to make sure everybody knew. So, to see them together is great.”

title: The 1 Item Meghan Markle Said She Always Had to Wear as a Royal
summary: Meghan, Duchess of Sussex is happy not to follow this royal fashion rule which she said was "inauthentic."
story: Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, has no trouble recalling one stuffy fashion custom she doesn't miss from her time as a working member of the British royal family.

“I had to wear nude pantyhose all the time. Let’s be honest, that was not very myself. I hadn’t seen pantyhose since movies in the ‘80s when they came in the little egg," the former Meghan Markle said, laughing, during a candid interview with  journalist Emily Chang published Aug. 26 on Bloomberg's "The Circuit."

Markle mentioned the pantyhose while noting that prior to her and husband Prince Harry's decision to step back from their roles in the royal family in 2020, it was a challenge for her to fully be herself in public.
“That felt a little inauthentic. It’s a silly example,” she said of the pantyhose.

“But it is an example of being able to dress the way you want to dress and say the things that are true and you’re able to show up in a space really organically and authentically, that’s being comfortable in your own skin and that’s had different chapters in my life," she added.
The interview arrived the same day of the Season 2 premiere of Markle's Netflix lifestyle series, "With Love, Meghan."
Netflix released a trailer for the new season on Aug. 12. The trailer showed Markle back in her kitchen and garden where she'll continue hosting celebrity chefs, lifestyle experts and famous friends.
The series, which premiered on March 4, 2025, focuses on Markle sharing tips about cooking, hosting, crafting, decorating and more.

Chrissy Teigen, Christina Tosi, Clare Smyth, Daniel Martin, David Chang, Heather Dorak, Jay Shetty, Jose Andres, Radhi Devlukia, Samin Nosrat and Tan France are all slated to make appearances in Season 2.

title: Food Brands Are Offering Freebies and Deals in Honor of Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce’s Engagement
summary: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's engagement inspired food brands like DoorDash, Portillo's, Papa Johns and California Pizza Kitchen to offer freebees and deals.
story: It was the engagement heard ‘round the world — and food brands are hopping on the betrothal bandwagon by discounting their wares.
On Aug. 26, Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce announced they are engaged to be married, and Swifties around the globe have fully leaned in to the joy of the moment.

Among those Swifties are chain restaurants, which have taken the opportunity to weigh in: Starbucks admitted its PSL drop was overshadowed; Panera and Auntie Anne’s punnily posted; and Buffalo Wild Wings offered to cater the wedding.
There are also some food brands who took the happy news to offer tasty discounts and freebies — like Krispy Kreme, who offered free doughnut rings for two hours on Aug. 26.
Here are all the food deals and specials being offered in honor of Swift and Kelce’s “Love Story”:
California Pizza Kitchen

Starting Aug. 29, California Pizza Kitchen is offering customers heart-shaped pizzas to celebrate T & T’s upcoming nuptials. For 13 days — Swift’s lucky number — CPK guests can order an “It’s a Love Story Pizza,” featuring a heart-shaped thin crust pizza in any flavor (starting at $17.99), available for a limited time for dine-in and takeout.
Papa Johns
If you share a name with the bride- or groom-to-be, you win.

On Aug. 27 only, Papa Johns is giving $13 worth of free Papa Dough — which can be used to get a free pizza — to every Papa Rewards member named Taylor or Travis. The bonus is available nationwide in-store, online and on the Papa Johns app, and it must be used by 12 a.m. EST.
Olipop
Olipop announced on Instagram that customers can take an extra 13% off any new or existing subscription order by using code LOVERS13.
This is on top of its 15% subscription discount, which means redeemers will get 28% off any one subscription order “from now until forever.”
DoorDash
Starting Aug. 27, DoorDash is offering Swifties 13% off their DoorDash order with the code THIRTEEN, for a limited time.
Portillo’s
Portillo’s perks members can score a free small Onion Rings with a purse of $1.13 or more. The offer is only valid for seven days and is limited to one redemption per customer.
Sonny’s BBQ

In honor of Swift and Kelce’s Instagram caption (“Your English teacher and your gym teacher are getting married”), Sonny’s BBQ is offering a BOGO BBQ Sandwich deal of Pork, Pulled Chicken or Turkey Sandwiches to all teachers dining in on Aug. 27 and 28. They just need to show a valid faculty ID to redeem it.

title: 'Love Is Blind: UK' Season 2 Finale: Who Got Married?
summary: Who gets married in the Love Is Blind UK season 2 finale? Find out what happens to all the couples.
story: And just like that, another season of "Love Is Blind: UK" is officially in the books.
The Netflix reality dating series returned for its sophomore season earlier this month and introduced viewers to a whole new cast of singles looking for love.
The series followed a total of five couples that got engaged and gave an update on who got married in the finale, which debuted on Aug. 27.
Was love truly blind for all of the couples? Find out below.
Bardha and Jed
Relationship status: Not married

What happened in the show? After speaking with Jed for the first time in the pods, Bardha said, "I just met my husband." Their chemistry grew quickly and they connected on their shared desire to have children. Soon, Jed started calling her "my Bardha."

While living together, the couple navigated a few cultural differences, namely Jed's desire to be the one who paid for his wife and took care of her financially. Meanwhile, Bardha admitted that she's used to being "strong and independent."

Before separating on the eve of their wedding, Bardha told Jed, "I don't want to be married twice. I'm not doing this again." On their wedding day, Bardha opened up in a confessional interview and admitted that she and Jed had been having a few arguments recently.

While speaking with his friends on the day of his wedding, Jed said he was confident that Bardha would say "I do," despite their differences in communication style. Jed then told his friends he was ready for marriage.
At the altar, Bardha said she wants to fully commit to Jed one day, just not now. Outside of the wedding venue, Bardha told Jed he had "all of my heart" and he corrected her, saying, "99% of it."
Jed asked Bardha why she decided to say "I don't" and she cited all the arguments they recently had, saying they'd left her "in a weird state of mind."

When members of Jed's family asked him what he planned to say at the altar, he seemed to be undecided. In a confessional interview, Bardha acknowledged that Jed may not be able to overcome this moment, but said she knows she made "the right decision."
Kieran and Megan
Relationship status: Married

What happened in the show: In the dating pods, Kieran initially had strong connections with two women: Sophie and Megan. When he gave Megan a sentimental gift, it solidified their bond and alienated Sophie.
Megan didn't grow up with solid examples of healthy romantic relationships and opened up to Kieran about how this had affected her approach to romance.
The couple went on to get engaged and had a strong emotional and physical connection. When Megan said "I love you" to Kieran, it marked the first time she'd done so in a relationship.

While reflecting on their relationship during his vows, Kieran grew emotional and recalled how Megan's "infectious laugh" hooked him from the get-go. "I still can't quite believe how perfect you are for me. You really are one of a kind," he said.
In her vows, Megan vowed to always be Kieran's "biggest cheerleader" and "sidekick through all of life's wild adventures."
"You have opened my eyes to a whole new realm of kindness and understanding that I truly have never felt before," she said.
Both Megan and Kieran said "I do" and celebrated their nuptials with family and friends. In a post-wedding interview, the newlyweds agreed they had no doubt that they were going to get married.
"This has been a fairytale for us and this is our happy ever after," Kieran said.
Sarover and Kal
Relationship status: Married

What happens in the show: When Kal first started speaking with Sarover in the pods, he fell for her "thoughtfulness," as he described in a confessional interview. On his wedding day, he mentioned this trait and many others that he had found in his bride.

While dating in the pods, the couple spoke about their cultural backgrounds and Sarover admitted that she's mostly dated Indian men in the past. Kal, who is half Pakistani, wondered how their cultural differences might concern their parents, but they both agreed that they felt such a strong bond that it shouldn't matter.
Outside the pods, the couple's relationship blossomed. On their wedding day, Sarover said Kal made her "feel safe" and his presence "brings me peace."
At the altar, the bride and groom read their own vows to each other.
“Your personality, your qualities is exactly the father I’ve always envisioned for my future children. You made me feel like the luckiest girl in the world,” she said.
When Kal ripped his vows up, it concerned Sarover at first, but he quickly told her it was all in his head and went on to describe how she's changed his life, calling her his "posh pod princess."
Sarover was first to say, "I do," followed by Kal. In a confessional interview following the wedding, Sarover said, "The fact that we fell in love, it shows love has no boundaries."
"True love shouldn't and does not discriminate," Kal added.
Billy and Ashleigh
Relationship status: Married

What happened in the show: Billy and Ashleigh had instant chemistry in the pods, but had to overcome one little obstacle: her profession as a cabin crew manager on an airline. Billy, who works as an army physical trainer, was concerned that their schedules would make it difficult to see each other regularly. Over time, he decided to give things a try and they got engaged.

Once they moved in, the couple realized they both have different approaches to life, with Billy being more rigid than Ashleigh, especially when it comes to food and diet. Some of their conversations left Ashleigh wondering how they could blend their two approaches together. Billy, who was previously divorced, was also cautious about getting into another marriage if he wasn't totally sure.

Flash forward to the wedding day and Ashleigh admitted that she wasn't sure where Billy's head was at. She said she felt "sick, worried, anxious" but hoped that they would say "I do." Meanwhile, Billy said he had concerns about their relationship, even if he loved Ashleigh more than anyone he's ever loved before.

In a confessional interview, Ashleigh said she's "always known" she wanted marriage from their relationship. Meanwhile, Billy said he hoped Ashleigh could forgive him if he did end up saying "no" at the altar.
When the moment arrived, the bride and groom spoke openly to each other. Ashleigh went first and said she fell in love with Billy for his "courage," "honesty" and "self-growth."
"Thank you, Billy, for restoring my faith and trust in love because I had given up, and for seeing me for who I am every single day," she said.
Billy applauded his bride for her "values," "heart" and "kindness to others."
"Coming into this experiment, I knew I had my insecurities, and you've made me a better man because of it," he said.
Both Billy and Ashleigh said "I do" and took a risk on love. In a post-ceremony interview, the bride asked the groom what made him say "yes."
"I was split down the middle for fear. I've been divorced before. I don't want to be divorced again. But I love you and I want to spend the rest of my life with you," he said.
Javen and Katisha
Relationship status: Broken up

What happened in the show: In Episode 9, viewers learned that Javen and Katisha dropped out of the dating experiment before the weddings stage. It didn't come as much of a surprise since the couple had a rocky road after getting engaged.

In the pods, Katisha had strong connections with both Javen and Demola. The former was more tightlipped about his feelings, while the latter was much more expressive. As the experiment progressed, Katisha seemed ready to commit to Demola and made him believe he was the one for her. Then she spoke with Javen, who was able to change her mind. She soon got engaged to Javen.

After the engaged couples moved in together, they got together with their cast mates one night. Javen decided to go out afterwards but Katisha opted to stay inside. Megan later told Katisha that Javen had been flirting with several of the women who were present at the late-night outing.
When Katisha confronts Javen, he says nothing inappropriate happened. She later decides to leave the experiment and leaves him the engagement ring and a note on a table.

title: Why Taylor Swift's Engagement Is Hitting Fans So Hard
summary: Fans share their emotional reactions to Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's Aug. 26 engagement news on social media. Here's why it means so much to fans.
story: When Olive Manella saw that Taylor Swift announced her engagement to Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce on Aug. 26, she started crying.

Manella shared a video of her hearing the news from her dad. While she thought he was joking with her at first, she soon pulled up the couple’s shared Instagram post of the moment and realized the news was true. She quickly became emotional.
“She’s literally written breakup song after breakup song and had her heart shattered so many times. And she’s finally in love and engaged,” Manella said through tears in a viral Instagram video.

Swift, 35, announced the step in her relationship with Kelce after over two years of dating. Manella, 26, said in the video that their happy ending is confirmation you should “wait for the right person.”
“Taylor, if you’re watching this, which you’re not, but if you ever see this … thank you for being an example,” Manella said.
For Some Fans, Swift's Engagement Made the World Stop

Manella is not alone in her enthusiastic reaction to the major development in Swift and Kelce’s love story. As the news spread, many fans also had emotional reactions to the celebrity couple’s relationship update.

Sararosa Davies, 27, a fan of Swift’s from Portland, Oregon, tells TODAY.com that when she saw a text from her fiancé at work about the proposal, she immediately “started crying and had to close the office door.”
She says she informed all of her coworkers and listened to Swift’s music throughout the rest of the day. “Focusing on work is very hard right now,” she adds.

Similarly, Amelia Villano, a Swiftie from Florida, says she was baking on a TikTok live when she learned about the engagement. She tells TODAY.com that she "held back sobs" as she told her husband the news.
“I’m getting choked up talking about it,” she says. “It just feels like such good news for someone who is a stranger but doesn’t feel like a stranger.”
Thrilled fan reactions took off online, with the Swiftie community coming together to express their shared joy for the pop star.
The joint announcement post itself received over 14 million likes in the first hour it was posted, quickly making its way to the top 20 list of most-liked posts on Instagram of all time.
The emotion is palpable in videos of people learning the news in workplaces and school hallways. One user shared a video of herself screaming with excitement on the floor after she found out.
Even Reese Witherspoon joined in on the fun, saying she needed to take time off from work — a common sentiment.
“you want me to work? taylor swift just told the world she is engaged to be married and you want me to work?” one fan posted on X, receiving over 13,000 reposts.

Natalie Marshall, the creator known as @corporatenatalie, shared her impression of “every woman in the world right now” reacting to the news at work. The imitation included Marshall interrupting the meeting to talk about the announcement and singing Swift’s song “Love Story” mid-conference call.
“Did I finish my compliance training when the biggest union of two individuals is about to occur in history? No, I haven’t gotten to it yet,” Marshall joked at the end of the video.
The post received over 100,000 likes on Instagram, with other viewers chiming in with their enthusiastic reactions to Swift’s announcement.
“She posted during America’s lunch hour and fed us rightfully,” one user commented.
“I am more excited for Taylor than I was for my own engagement lol,” added another.
Some fans agreed that the news feels like a loved one was announcing their engagement.
“I feel like I’m congratulating my very close personal friend,” one user said in a video on TikTok. “She has no clue who I am, but I’m so happy for her.”
Why Does Swift’s Engagement Mean So Much to Fans?
Swifties say the news hits hard because they feel like they have bonded with the singer throughout her 20-year music career.

The connection is especially strong for millennial women, Caroline Dettman tells TODAY.com, because their generation has aged with Swift, experiencing life events around the same time as she was singing about them.
Dettman, who, like Swift, is also in her mid-30s, says she started tearing up a little bit when Swift’s post popped up on Instagram.

“A lot of women my age have gone through the eras with Taylor,” she says. “‘Reputation’ came out when we were all getting out of our first serious relationships. ‘Lover’ came out when we were finding our next great love. It bonds myself and others like me to her.”
She says she, along with other fans, have “the parasocial relationship of parasocial relationships” with Swift. Seeing her find happiness with Kelce feels like seeing a friend find love, she says.
“It brings hope and joy to us at the same time,” Dettmann adds. “It just really feels like we’ve grown up with her.”

“She puts words to our past, be it good or bad, and warns of what may be or the joys to come,” Kelsey Barr, a fan of Swift’s from New Jersey, echoes to TODAY.com. “She has been a big sister to so many of us.”
The Message the Engagement Is Sending? 'The Right Person Is Worth the Wait'

After the engagement, fans turned to Swift's past lyrics as evidence of a romantic journey. In songs like "The Prophecy," she expressed the fear that she might never find love — and now, they say, she has. Fans say Swift's story gives them hope for their own love lives.

“The Taylor Swift engagement is hitting so hard for us bc it gives us all hope that we will someday get there,” one user wrote in the text of a TikTok video. “The girl who wrote all the songs we cry over boys to finally has her happily ever after and so will we.”
“She has been through so much and so have we,” one fan commented on the video.
“We’re really going to find someone someday who will treat us well,” another commented.
“She’s proof it gets better,” another user shared in a reaction video.
Hannah Pennell, 36, a fan of Swift’s from Florida, tells TODAY.com that Swift’s engagement sends the message that the “right person is worth the wait.”
"As someone getting engaged in your mid to late 30s, we all know what the girl went through. She still managed to keep her heart open and kept trying," she says.
“I think this gives lots of women hope and excitement,” Pennell continues. “We are so privileged to have had her document everything because it’s stuff we all can relate to and be encouraged by.”

title: ‘Saturday Night Live’ Season 51: Everything To Know About the Premiere, Cast and More
summary: "Saturday Night Live" is returning to NBC this fall. See what the show's creator, Lorne Michaels, has said about the new season so far.
story: After Lorne Michaels said he plans on shaking up the "Saturday Night Live" lineup for Season 51, several cast members have announced they will not be returning to the sketch comedy show.

In an August interview with Puck News, the "SNL" creator talked about the future of the hit show, which has been running since 1975. He confirmed at the time that he planned to "shake things up" after the landmark 50th season.

"I wanted people coming back and being part of (the 50th season)," Michaels told the outlet. "And that meant there couldn’t be those kind of disruptions (to the cast), or anything that was going to take the focus off (the 50th season)."
He added that he feels "pressure to reinvent" after Season 50.
"Yeah, for sure," Michaels answered. "It’ll be announced in a week or so."
Michaels has seemingly started finalizing the Season 51 cast, and two “SNL” cast members have shared that they won’t be returning.
Scroll below to see everything there is to know about the upcoming season of "SNL."
When is 'Saturday Night Live' returning?
Season 51 of "Saturday Night Live" will premiere on NBC on Oct. 4, per NBC Insider.
Who Is In the Cast of 'Saturday Night Live' Season 51?
Though Michaels has yet to confirm the new cast of "SNL," he told Puck on Aug. 22 that cast shakeups would be "announced in a week or so."
When asked specifically if comedian James Austin Johnson will reprise his role as U.S. President Donald Trump, Michaels said, "yes."
Since that interview, cast members Devon Walker and Emil Wakim have announced they won't be in Season 51.

In an Aug. 27 Instagram post, Wakim, who spent one season on the show as a featured player, said he learned he wouldn't be returning to the show when he was out celebrating a friend's birthday at Six Flags.
"It was a gut punch of a call to get but I’m so grateful for my time there," he said.
As for Walker, who joined the show in 2022, he said leaving "SNL" after three years feels like a divorce.

“To me, jobs in this industry feel like a bunch of little marriages. Some of ‘em last for a long time if we’re lucky, but most of them are fleeting," he said on Instagram on Aug. 25. "Permanent until they’re not. That’s the deal. You know what it is when you sign up."
"me and baby broke up," he added in the caption, accompanying a photo of himself next to the "Saturday Night Live" title card.
"SNL" has not yet announced its full Season 51 cast lineup yet.
The cast of Season 50 consisted of:

Michael CheMikey DayAndrew DismukesChloe FinemanHeidi GardnerMarcello HernándezJames Austin JohnsonColin JostMichael LongfellowEgo NwodimSarah ShermanKenan ThompsonDevon WalkerBowen YangPlus, featured players Ashley Padilla, Emil Wakim and Jane Wickline

Where Can I Watch 'Saturday Night Live' Season 51?
After its Oct. 4 debut, new episodes of "SNL" will air Saturdays on NBC and will be available to stream on Peacock the next day. (Peacock and TODAY.com share a parent company, NBCUniversal.)
Is Lorne Michaels Retiring?
Lorne Michaels created "Saturday Night Live," and 50 years later, he's said he's not done with the program. Ahead of the anniversary special, many wondered about Michaels' future with the show.
In February, Michaels, 80, told the New York Times, “I may be wrong. But I don’t feel I’m done.”
In the August interview, Puck asked if he plans on giving some added responsibilities to some of his team members.
